content.question: Let <math alttext="l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>ℓ</mo></mrow></math> be the line tangent to the graph of <math alttext="y equals the fraction 1 over x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> at <math alttext="x equals 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></math>. What is the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-coordinate of the point of intersection of <math alttext="l" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>ℓ</mo></mrow></math> and the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis?

choices.label: <math alttext="3 minus the fraction with numerator 1, and denominator 3 times the natural log of 3, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>−</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
